   20: 
   21: -module(shell_docs_SUITE).
   22: -moduledoc false.
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   25:    init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   26: 
   27: -export([render/1, links/1, normalize/1, render_prop/1,render_non_native/1]).
   28: -export([render_function/1, render_type/1, render_callback/1]).
   29: 
   30: -export([render_all/1, update_render/0, update_render/1]).
   31: 
   32: -export([execute/3]).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("kernel/include/eep48.hrl").
   35: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{timetrap,{minutes,30}}].
   39: 
   40: all() ->
   41:     [ {group, render},
   42:       {group, prop},
   43:       {group, render_smoke}
   44:     ].
   45: 
   46: groups() ->
   47:     [ {prop,[],[render_prop]},
   48:       {render, [], [render, render_non_native, links, normalize]},
   49:       {render_smoke, [], [render_function, render_type, render_callback]}
   50:     ].
   51: 
   52: %% Include a spec here in order to test that specs of undocumented functions
   53: %% is rendered correctly.
   54: -spec init_per_suite(Config1) -> Config2 when
   55:       Config1 :: list({atom(),term()}),
   56:       Config2 :: list({atom(),term()}).
   57: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   58:     {ok, ?MODULE} = c:c(?MODULE,[debug_info]),
   59:     Config.
   60: 
   61: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   62:     ok.
   63: 
   64: init_per_group(prop, Config) ->
   65:     ct_property_test:init_per_suite(Config);
   66: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   67:     Config.
   68: 
   69: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   70:     Config.
   71: 
   72: %% We keep the docs of a couple of complex modules
   73: %% in the data_dir in order to compare then with the original
   74: %% when we fix bugs so that we don't break anything.
   75: %%
   76: %% This testcase is always run so that we do now forget to
   77: %% check that any bugfix does not break the current behaviour.
   78: %%
   79: %% If you do a bugfix that does not break this testcase when
   80: %% fixed you should include that module in the list of modules
   81: %% tested.
   82: %%
   83: %% Currently the modules are:
   84: -define(RENDER_MODULES, [sofs, re, file, erlang, user_drv, ?MODULE]).
   85: %% If you need to update the definition because this
   86: %% testcase fails, just run update_render/0,1.
   87: render(Config) ->
   88: 
   89:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   90: 
   91:     lists:foreach(
   92:       fun(Module) ->
   93:               {ok, [D]} = file:consult(filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".docs_v1")),
   94:               maps:map(
   95:                 fun(FName, Current) ->
   96:                         case file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir,FName)) of
   97:                             {ok, Original} when Original =:= Current ->
   98:                                 ok;
   99:                             {ok, Original} ->
  100:                                 ct:log("Original: ~n~ts",[Original]),
  101:                                 ct:log("Current : ~n~ts",[Current]),
  102:                                 ct:fail(output_changed);
  103:                             {error, enoent} ->
  104:                                 %% All modules are not available on all
  105:                                 %% platforms. For instance socket is not
  106:                                 %% available on windows.
  107:                                 ok
  108:                         end
  109:                 end, render_module(Module, D))
  110:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  111: 
  112: update_render() ->
  113:     update_render(
  114:       filename:join([os:getenv("ERL_TOP"),
  115:                      "lib", "stdlib", "test", "shell_docs_SUITE_data"])).
  116: update_render(DataDir) ->
  117:     lists:foreach(
  118:       fun(Module) ->
  119:               case code:get_doc(Module) of
  120:                   {ok, D} ->
  121:                       ok = file:write_file(
  122:                              filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".docs_v1"),
  123:                              io_lib:format("~w.",[D])),
  124:                       maps:map(
  125:                         fun(FName, Output) ->
  126:                                 ok = file:write_file(filename:join(DataDir, FName), Output)
  127:                         end, render_module(Module, D));
  128:                   E ->
  129:                       io:format("Error processing: ~p ~p",[Module, E])
  130:               end
  131:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  132: 
  133: handle_error({error,_}) ->
  134:   ok;
  135: handle_error(Doc) ->
  136:   unicode:characters_to_binary(Doc).
  137: 
  138: only_if_smp(Func) ->
  139:     only_if_smp(4, Func).
  140: only_if_smp(Schedulers, Func) ->
  141:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  142:       N when N < Schedulers -> {skip,"Too few schedulers online"};
  143:       _ -> Func()
  144:     end.
  145: 
  146: %%
  147: %% Render function
  148: %%
  149: %% This function tests that OTP code base can print its documentation
  150: %% in the shell. It is a time consuming operation that can take
  151: %% up-to 40 - 50 min if run in a single processor (1 scheduler config) machine.
  152: %%
  153: %% Skip the test case when running in a machine with not enough SMP.
  154: %%
  155: %% OBS. render_type/render_callback have shorter times and do not need
  156: %%      to be skipped, regardless of the number of available schedulers.
  157: %% 
  158: render_function(_Config) ->
  159:   only_if_smp(fun render_function_do/0).
  160: 
  161: render_function_do() ->
  162:     docsmap(
  163:       fun(Mod, D) ->
  164:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  165:               Exports = try Mod:module_info(exports)
  166:                         catch _:undef -> []
  167:                         end, %% nif file not available on this platform
  168:               pmap(
  169:                 fun(Config) ->
  170:                         try
  171:                             handle_error(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Config)),
  172:                             [try
  173:                                  handle_error(shell_docs:render(Mod, F, A, DHTML, Config))
  174:                              catch _E:R:ST ->
  175:                                      io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  176:                                                [Mod,F,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_doc(Mod,F,A)]),
  177:                                      erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  178:                              end || {F,A} <- Exports]
  179:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  180:                                 io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  181:                                 exit(R)
  182:                         end
  183:                 end, format_configurations())
  184:       end),
  185:     ok.
  186: 
  187: render_type(_Config) ->
  188:     docsmap(
  189:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  190:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  191:               pmap(
  192:                 fun(Config) ->
  193:                         try
  194:                           handle_error(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Config)),
  195:                           [try
  196:                              handle_error(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  197:                            catch _E:R:ST ->
  198:                                io:format("Failed to render type ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  199:                                          [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_type_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  200:                                erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  201:                            end || {{type,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs]
  202:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  203:                             io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  204:                             exit(R)
  205:                         end
  206:                 end, format_configurations())
  207:       end),
  208:   ok.
  209: 
  210: render_callback(_Config) ->
  211:     docsmap(
  212:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  213:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  214:               pmap(
  215:                 fun(Config) ->
  216:                         try
  217:                           handle_error(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Config)),
  218:                           [try
  219:                              handle_error(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  220:                            catch _E:R:ST ->
  221:                                io:format("Failed to render callback ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  222:                                          [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_callback_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  223:                                erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  224:                            end || {{callback,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs]
  225:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  226:                             io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  227:                             exit(R)
  228:                         end
  229:                 end, format_configurations())
  230:       end),
  231:     ok.
  232: 
  233: docsmap(Fun) ->
  234:   F = fun F({Mod,_,_}) ->
  235:             F(Mod);
  236:           F(Mod) when is_list(Mod) ->
  237:             F(list_to_atom(Mod));
  238:           F(Mod) ->
  239:             case code:get_doc(Mod) of
  240:               {error, missing} ->
  241:                 ok;
  242:               {error, cover_compiled} ->
  243:                 ok;
  244:               {error, E} when E =:= eperm; E =:= eacces; E =:= eio ->
  245:                 %% This can happen in BSD's for some reason...
  246:                 ok;
  247:               {error, eisdir} ->
  248:                 %% Uhm?
  249:                 ok;
  250:               {ok, Docs} ->
  251:                 try
  252:                   _ = Fun(Mod, Docs),
  253:                   {ok, self(), Mod}
  254:                 catch E:R:ST ->
  255:                     io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p:~p~n",[Mod,E,R,ST]),
  256:                     erlang:raise(E,R,ST)
  257:                 end
  258:             end
  259:       end,
  260:   lists:foreach(F, code:all_available()),
  261:   ok.
  262: 
  263: 
  264: format_configurations() ->
  265:   [#{},
  266:    #{ ansi => false },
  267:    #{ ansi => true },
  268:    #{ columns => 5 },
  269:    #{ columns => 150 },
  270:    #{ encoding => unicode },
  271:    #{ encoding => latin1 }].
  272: 
  273: markdown_to_shelldoc(#docs_v1{format = Format}=Docs) ->
  274:     DefaultFormat = <<"text/markdown">>,
  275:     DFormat = binary_to_list(DefaultFormat),
  276:     case Format of
  277:         _ when Format =:= DefaultFormat orelse Format =:= DFormat ->
  278:             ModuleDoc = Docs#docs_v1.module_doc,
  279:             Doc = Docs#docs_v1.docs,
  280:             Docs#docs_v1{format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT,
  281:                          module_doc = process_moduledoc(ModuleDoc),
  282:                          docs = process_doc_attr(Doc)};
  283:         _  ->
  284:             Docs
  285:     end.
  286: 
  287: -spec process_moduledoc(Doc :: map() | none | hidden) -> map() | none | hidden.
  288: process_moduledoc(Doc) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  289:     Doc;
  290: process_moduledoc(Doc) when is_map(Doc) ->
  291:     maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc).
  292: 
  293: process_doc_attr(Doc) ->
  294:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Doc).
  295: 
  296: process_doc(Docs) when is_list(Docs) ->
  297:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Docs);
  298: process_doc({_At, _A, _S, Doc, _M}=Entry) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  299:     Entry;
  300: process_doc({Attributes, Anno, Signature, Doc, Metadata}) ->
  301:     Docs = maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc),
  302:     {Attributes, Anno, Signature, Docs, Metadata}.
  303: 
  304: 
  305: render_prop(Config) ->
  306: %    dbg:tracer(),dbg:p(all,c),dbg:tpl(shell_docs_prop,[]),
  307:     ct_property_test:quickcheck(
  308:       shell_docs_prop:prop_render(),Config).
  309: 
  310: links(_Config) ->
  311:     docsmap(
  312:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ module_doc = MDoc, docs = Docs, format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT }) ->
  313:               try
  314:                   [check_links(Mod, maps:get(<<"en">>,MDoc)) || MDoc =/= none, MDoc =/= hidden]
  315:               catch _E1:R1:ST1 ->
  316:                       io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  317:                                 [Mod,R1,ST1,MDoc]),
  318:                       erlang:raise(error,R1,ST1)
  319:               end,
  320:               [try
  321:                   check_links(Mod, D)
  322:                catch _E:R:ST ->
  323:                        io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  324:                                  [Mod,Kind,R,ST,D]),
  325:                        erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  326:                end || {Kind,_Anno,_Sig,#{ <<"en">> := D },_MD} <- Docs];
  327:          (Mod, #docs_v1{ format = Fmt }) ->
  328:               io:format("Skipping ~p because format is ~ts~n",
  329:                         [Mod, Fmt])
  330:       end).
  331: 
  332: check_links(Mod, [{a,Attr,C}|T]) ->
  333:     case proplists:get_value(rel,Attr) of
  334:         <<"https://erlang.org/doc/link/seemfa">> ->
  335:             case string:lexemes(proplists:get_value(href, Attr),":#/") of
  336:                 [_App,TargetMod,Func,Arity] ->
  337:                     case code:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod)) of
  338:                         {ok, _ModDoc} ->
  339:                             case shell_docs:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod),
  340:                                                     b2a(Func),
  341:                                                     binary_to_integer(Arity)) of
  342:                                 [] -> throw({could_not_find,b2a(TargetMod),
  343:                                                 b2a(Func),
  344:                                                 binary_to_integer(Arity)});
  345:                                 _Else  -> ok
  346:                             end;
  347:                         _Else ->
  348:                             throw({could_not_find, TargetMod, Attr})
  349:                     end;
  350:                 _Callback ->
  351:                     ok
  352:             end;
  353:         _OtherlinkType ->
  354:             ok
  355:     end,
  356:     check_links(Mod, C),
  357:     check_links(Mod, T);
  358: check_links(Mod, [{_,_,C}|T]) ->
  359:     check_links(Mod, C),
  360:     check_links(Mod, T);
  361: check_links(Mod, [C|T]) when is_binary(C) ->
  362:     check_links(Mod, T);
  363: check_links(_, []) ->
  364:     ok.
  365: 
  366: normalize(_Config) ->
  367:     ?assertMatch(
  368:        [{p,[],[{em,[],[<<"a ">>,{code,[],[<<"b ">>]},<<"c">>]}]}],
  369:        shell_docs:normalize([{p,[],[{em,[],[<<" a ">>,{code,[],[<<" b  ">>]},<<" c">>]}]}])
  370:       ),
  371:     ?assertMatch(
  372:        [{'div',[],[<<"!">>]}],
  373:        shell_docs:normalize([{'div',[],[{code,[],[<<" ">>,{i,[],[<<" ">>]}]},<<" !">>]}])
  374:       ),
  375:     ok.
  376: 
  377: %% Special binary_to_atom that deals with <<"'and'">>
  378: b2a(Bin) ->
  379:     case erl_scan:string(binary_to_list(Bin)) of
  380:         {ok,[{atom,_,A}],_} -> A;
  381:         {ok,[{A,_}],_} -> A
  382:     end.
  383: 
  384: %% Test rendering of non-native modules
  385: render_non_native(_Config) ->
  386:     Docs = #docs_v1{
  387:         anno = erl_anno:new(13),
  388:         beam_language = not_erlang,
  389:         format = <<"text/asciidoc">>,
  390:         module_doc = #{<<"en">> => <<"This is\n\npure text">>},
  391:         docs = []
  392:     },
  393: 
  394:     <<"\n\tnot_an_erlang_module\n\n"
  395:       "    This is\n"
  396:       "    \n"
  397:       "    pure text\n">> =
  398:         unicode:characters_to_binary(
  399:           shell_docs:render(not_an_erlang_module, Docs, #{ ansi => false })),
  400: 
  401:     ok.
  402: 
  403: %% Testing functions
  404: render_all(Dir) ->
  405:     file:make_dir(Dir),
  406:     %% We load all possible application in order to be able to use
  407:     %% application:get_application to get the application a module
  408:     %% belongs to.
  409:     PossibleApplications =
  410:         lists:flatmap(
  411:           fun(P) ->
  412:                   filelib:wildcard(filename:join(P, "*.app"))
  413:           end, code:get_path()),
  414:     [application:load(list_to_atom(filename:basename(filename:rootname(App)))) ||
  415:         App <- PossibleApplications],
  416:     docsmap(fun(Mod, D) ->
  417:                     maps:map(
  418:                       fun(FName, Value) ->
  419:                               file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, FName), Value)
  420:                       end, render_module(Mod, D))
  421:             end).
  422: 
  423: render_module(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  424:     Opts = #{ ansi => true, columns => 80, encoding => unicode },
  425:     case application:get_application(Mod) of
  426:         {ok, App} ->
  427:             App;
  428:         _ ->
  429:             App = unknown
  430:     end,
  431:     SMod = atom_to_list(App) ++ "_" ++ atom_to_list(Mod),
  432:     Files =
  433:         #{
  434:           SMod ++ ".txt" =>
  435:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Opts)),
  436:           SMod ++ "_type.txt" =>
  437:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Opts)),
  438:           SMod ++ "_cb.txt" =>
  439:                     unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Opts))
  440:          },
  441:     lists:foldl(
  442:       fun({_Type,_Anno,_Sig,none,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  443:               Acc;
  444:          ({{function,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  445:               FAName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_func.txt",
  446:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_func.txt",
  447:               FADocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts)),
  448:               FDocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, D, Opts)),
  449:               case string:equal(FADocs,FDocs) of
  450:                   true -> 
  451:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs };
  452:                   false ->
  453:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs,
  454:                             sanitize(FName) => FDocs}
  455:               end;
  456:          ({{type,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  457:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_type.txt",
  458:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  459:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))};
  460:          ({{callback,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  461:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_cb.txt",
  462:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  463:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))}
  464:       end, Files, Docs).
  465: 
  466: sanitize(FName) ->
  467:     lists:foldl(
  468:       fun({Re,Replace}, Txt) ->
  469:               re:replace(Txt,Re,Replace,[global,{return,list}])
  470:       end, FName, [{"/","slash"},{":","colon"},
  471:                    {"\\*","star"},{"<","lt"},{">","gt"},{"=","eq"}]).
  472: 
  473: %%
  474: %% Parallel map function.
  475: %%
  476: %% Parallel map function that discards the result of the function
  477: %% `F` applied to each of the items in `Ls`. It spawns as many
  478: %% processes as items there are in `Ls`. If the list is large,
  479: %% consider adding a set of working processes that round-robin on
  480: %% the job to do be done.
  481: %%
  482: %% - `F` is the function to perform
  483: %% - `Ls` the list of items to iterate on
  484: %%
  485: pmap(F, Ls) when is_function(F),
  486:                  is_list(Ls) ->
  487:   _ = lists:foreach(fun(Config) ->
  488:                         spawn_link(?MODULE, execute,[Config, F, self()])
  489:                    end, Ls),
  490:   ResponseCounter = length(Ls),
  491:   ok = sync(ResponseCounter),
  492:   ok.
  493: 
  494: execute(Item, F, Pid) ->
  495:   _ = F(Item),
  496:   Pid ! ok.
  497: 
  498: sync(0) ->
  499:   ok;
  500: sync(N) ->
  501:   receive
  502:     ok ->
  503:       sync(N-1)
  504:   end.
